usefulItems: 2 baking trays (30 x 40 cm), bowl, kitchen towel, pastry brush, oven
title: Flaky filo fingers

ingredients.content: 180 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces (3 cm), plus extra for greasing
2 - 3 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into quarters
500 g frozen chopped spinach, thawed and excess moisture squeezed out (approx. 250 g after moisture removed)

preparations.content: Grease 2 baking trays (30 x 40 cm) with butter and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>3 min/100°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place spring onions/shallots into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add oil and cook <b>2 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add spinach and cook <b>1 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>. Set aside in mixing bowl to cool for 10 minutes.
Add feta, ricotta, egg, salt and pepper and combine <b>15-20 sec//speed 3<b>. Set aside in mixing bowl.

Place 1 sheet of filo pastry onto a clean work surface, keeping remaining pastry covered with a clean, damp kitchen towel. Brush filo sheet with reserved melted butter. Place a second sheet on top, then brush with butter. Place a third sheet on top and brush with butter. Cut pastry into 3 strips (each 14 cm wide), then cut into halves (forming 14 cm x 13.5 cm rectangles).

Place 1 tablespoon of the reserved spinach mixture along bottom edge of each rectangle. Fold in side edges by 1 cm and brush with melted butter. Fold over end of pastry to overlap filling, then roll up, making sure edges are tucked inside and filling is sealed, forming a finger shape. Place seam side down onto prepared baking trays, leaving at least a 3 cm gap between each roll. Repeat with remaining pastry, filling and butter (makes approx. 36 fingers - see Tips).
Brush tops of fingers with melted butter and bake for 18-20 minutes (180°C), until lightly golden and crisp. Serve warm or at room temperature.

hintsAndTricks: A firm (Australian) feta works best for this recipe.
Unbaked filo fingers can be placed into a freezable storage container and frozen for up to 3 weeks. They can be baked from frozen for 18-20 minutes (180°C), until lightly golden and crisp.
1 brown onion (approx. 100 g), cut into quarters
100 g red capsicum, deseeded and cut into pieces
3 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
250 g each pork mince, beef mince and lamb mince
½ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
